titles.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution to provide that, except in time of war or economic emergency declared by the Congress, expenditures of the Government may not exceed the revenues of the Government during any fiscal year.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Monopolies and Commercial Law.

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits total Federal expenditures from exceeding net revenues. Authorizes suspension of such prohibition in time of war or national economic emergency upon the concurrence of two-thirds of the Members of each House of the Congress. Requires the Congress, with respect to such a suspension, to consider the extent and rate of industrial activity, unemployment, inflation, and other appropriate factors.
